document_data.name: Flavor
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|7}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Flavor''''' was a useful [[cantrip]] that beginning [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It altered or improved the taste of food or drink.
document_data.Effects: The target of this spell had to be within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} of the caster. This cantrip only changed the perceived taste of food or drink. A bowl of mush could be made to taste like [[lobster]], but it still looked, felt, and poured like mush. ''Flavor'' did not remove spoilage, change texture, or improve nutrition, but could be used to disguise the taste of spoiled food or the taint of [[poison]].
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster made a shaking motion with a hand while smacking his or her lips.
